column1: Bhadrachalam  is a census town in  the Indian state of Telangana
column2: Bhadradri Kothagudem district. It is an important Hindu pilgrimage town with the Bhadrachalam Temple of Lord Rama
column3: situated on the banks of Godavari river. It is located 312 kilometres (194 mi) from east of state capital
column10: from the Andhra Pradesh State Capital Amaravathi

column1: The town has a documented history of Lord Sri Rama temple constructed circa 17th century CE by Kancherla Gopanna (nearly 370 years ago).Kancherla Gopanna (1620 - 1680)
column2: popularly known as Bhadradri Ramadasu or Bhadrachala Ramadasu
column3: was a 17th-century Indian devotee of Rama and a composer of Carnatic music. His devotional lyrics to Rama are famous in South Indian classical music as Ramadaasu Keertanalu
column4: and have made Bhadrachalam a place of religious importance for Hindus.

column1: Bhadrachalam is located at 17.67°N 80.88°E﻿ / 17.67; 80.88. It has an average elevation of 50 metres (164 feet).

column4: Males constitute 50% of the population and females 50%. Bhadrachalam has an average literacy rate of 73%
column5: higher than the national average of 59.5%. 11% of the population is under 6 years of age.

column1: The state bus service TSRTC operates a bus station in Bhadrachalam connecting the town to various places of the state. Andhrapradesh state bus service APSRTC operates buses frequently to Bhadrachalam.
The nearest railway station is Bhadrachalam Road railway station
